-T1Feeding123.notes: Make sure to add the new dry food.

-T2CleanToilet456.notes: Check for new litter clumps to remove.

-T6BuyFood789.notes: Buy dry food and wet pouches.

-T9Walks789.notes: Use the red leash for safety.

Feeding.description: Cats thrive on a regular feeding schedule with the right type and amount of food. Ensure you’re providing age-appropriate meals (kitten, adult, or senior formulas) and adjusting portion sizes based on your cat’s weight and activity level. Avoid overfeeding to prevent obesity and provide fresh food at each feeding time.
Feeding.recommendation: How Much to Feed: Kittens (under 1 year): Feed 3–4 small meals daily. Adult cats (1–7 years): Feed 2 meals daily, following the guidelines on your cat food packaging (usually 20–30 calories per pound of body weight). Senior cats (7+ years): Adjust based on activity level and health, consulting your vet for specific needs.
Feeding.frequency: 1-2 times per day, depending on your cat’s age and health.

Clean Toilet.description: A clean litter box is essential for your cat's comfort and hygiene. Scoop out waste daily and completely change the litter every 1-2 weeks, depending on the type of litter you use. Use soap and water to clean the box and ensure it’s placed in a quiet, private location for your cat.
Clean Toilet.recommendation: Scoop the litter box daily. Replace all litter and deep clean the box every 1–2 weeks. Use unscented litter and avoid abrupt changes to litter type.

Give Bath.description: While most cats groom themselves, occasional baths may be necessary if your cat gets into something sticky or dirty. Use cat-safe shampoo and lukewarm water, ensuring a calm environment. Dry your cat thoroughly with a towel or a pet-safe dryer on a low setting.
Give Bath.recommendation: Avoid bathing more than once every 4–6 weeks. Short-haired cats rarely need baths, while long-haired cats may need more frequent grooming.

Water Refill.description: Fresh water is crucial for your cat's health. Check and refill their water bowl or fountain daily, ensuring it’s clean and free of debris. Cats are often more encouraged to drink from running water, so a cat water fountain might be a good option.
Water Refill.recommendation: Wash and refill their water bowl or clean their fountain daily. Cats need about 3.5–4.5 ounces of water per 5 pounds of body weight daily.

Play Time.description: Cats need mental stimulation and exercise to stay happy and healthy. Dedicate at least 10–20 minutes a day for interactive play using toys like laser pointers, feather wands, or balls. Rotate toys to keep things interesting and engage their natural hunting instincts.
Play Time.recommendation: Play helps reduce stress, prevents obesity, and supports mental stimulation. Use toys that mimic prey movements to engage your cat’s instincts.

Reminders to Buy Food.description: Stay stocked up on your cat’s favorite food to avoid disruptions to their feeding routine. Keep track of how much food you have left and set reminders to reorder or purchase more before you run out.
Reminders to Buy Food.recommendation: Dry food: Replenish a 5-lb bag every 4–6 weeks. Wet food: Stock up weekly or biweekly. Keep an extra week’s supply to avoid running out unexpectedly.

Medication.description: If your cat is on medication, consistent dosing is key. Follow your vet’s instructions carefully, whether it’s pills, topical treatments, or injections. Use reminders to ensure you never miss a dose.
Medication.recommendation: Follow vet instructions. Pills: Daily or twice daily. Topical treatments: Monthly. Injections: Weekly or yearly as prescribed.

Vet Visits.description: Regular vet checkups are crucial for your cat’s health. Kittens and senior cats may need more frequent visits, while healthy adults can usually go annually. Schedule appointments for vaccinations, dental checkups, and any concerns you have about their behavior or well-being.
Vet Visits.recommendation: Annual check for healthy adults. Biannual for senior cats. Monthly reminders for special treatments.

-C3MajesticSimba789.name: Emma

-C4PlayfulOliver123.name: Mike
-C4PlayfulOliver123.description: Oliver is all about fun and games. Today, he decided to wear a tiny bowtie for extra charm. Who can resist that face?

-C5FluffyMittens456.name: Sophia
-C5FluffyMittens456.description: Mittens loves dressing up for every occasion! Here she is in her cozy winter hat, ready to snuggle by the fire.

-C6AdventurousLuna789.name: Chris
-C6AdventurousLuna789.description: Luna is always up for an adventure! Today, she's exploring the garden in her safari hat. Watch out, world!

-C7CozyBella123.name: Anna

-C8FashionCharlie456.name: Liam

-C9ElegantCleo789.name: Mia

-C10HappyBoots123.name: Noah
